main event: Multiple observers reported seeing five unidentified flying objects over Hastings, Michigan on July 6 and July 12, 1957.
interesting points: The objects were described as bright, silver, round in shape and moved off to the north followed by jet aircraft., One observed object rapidly ascended and disappeared while the others changed directions multiple times., The objects displayed maneuvers such as horizontal and vertical movement, accelerating and decelerating., Witnesses estimated the size of one object to be 250-300 feet in diameter., The sightings were recorded in detail in Project Blue Book reports, but no photographs were included.
sighted object: five bright, round objects in the sky
witness description: independent groups of observers who agreed on the object's characteristics
